programme.title: Clara
programme.desc: An obsessive astronomer and a curious artist form an unlikely bond which leads them to a profound scientific discovery.

programme.title: White Irish Drinkers
programme.desc: A coming of age story set in 1975 working-class Brooklyn, in which two teenage brothers living with their abusive father and their well-meaning but ineffective mother are caught up in a life of petty crime. Older brother Danny concocts a daring scheme to steal enough money for the two to escape, timed around the chaos of an upcoming Rolling Stones concert. The sensitive younger brother, Brian, ultimately has a choice: remain loyal to the brother with whom he shares a powerful love-hate bond, or use his hidden talent as an artist as his own ticket out of their dead-end existence.

programme.title: Lymelife
programme.desc: Based on the true childhood experiences of director Derick Martini, Lymelife is the coming of age story of 15-year old Scott growing up in suburban Long Island. While caught up in his first love, Scott watches the relationships of his parents and their neighbors slowly crumble as they try to keep up with the changing times and expectations of the 1970s. Critically acclaimed, Lymelife features a magnificent ensemble cast, with incredible performances that make you laugh and cry along with them.

programme.title: Miss Potter
programme.desc: Biography of children's author Beatrix Potter, including how she overcame a domineering mother and the chauvinism of Victorian England to become a best-selling author.

programme.title: The Artist
programme.desc: Hollywood 1927. George Valentin (Jean Dujardin) is a silent movie superstar. The advent of the talkies will sound the death knell for his career and see him fall into oblivion. For young extra Peppy Miller (Berenice Bejo), it seems the sky's the limit - major movie stardom awaits. THE ARTIST tells the story of their interlinked destinies.

programme.title: Mad Money
programme.desc: Deep inside the most secure bank in America, three desperate women from very different worlds cook up the most unlikely heist of the century: Smuggle out millions of dollars in worn-out currency headed for a Federal Reserve shredder every day.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Broken Lives" - Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Life Interrupted" - During her career as a medical examiner, Dr. G has autopsied thousands of murder victims. In this episode, Dr. G shares her most memorable case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Journey" - Dr. G reviews a woman's medical records and learns that that she suffered from an auto-immune disease called lupus, which might have something to do with her death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Speeds" - Motor vehicle fatalities account for many of the cases that come into the morgue. Dr. G offers expertise as to how to get behind the wheel and not wind up on a steel table.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Fatal Flaw" - Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Dive" - A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Decent" - It's up to Dr. G, along with the National Transportation Safety Board, to piece together how and why a plane crashed, leaving the pilot dead.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Deadly Deal" - Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Evil Intent" - Authorities respond to a fire, only to find Carolyn Casey's body at the center of the blaze. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must find the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Disturbing Behavior" - Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.desc: Fred and Carrie meet the Mayor of Portland who gives them a special assignment. Special Guest Star Kyle MacLachlan. Also guest starting Aubrey Plaza and Sam Adams.

programme.title: Portlandia:Aimee
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie discover that their maid is none other than their favorite singer-songwriter Aimee Mann. Guest Starring Aimee Mann and Sarah McLachlan.

programme.title: Portlandia:Mayor is Missing
programme.desc: When the Mayor goes missing, Fred and Carrie begin a frantic search for him. Special Guest Star Kyle MacLachlan. Also guest starring Edie McClurg, Aubrey Plaza, Kumail Nanjiani and Sam Adams.

programme.title: Portlandia:Baseball
programme.desc: The Mayor turns to Fred and Carrie to help him put together a big league baseball team. Special Guest Star Kyle MacLachlan. Also guest starring Heather Graham and Nick Kroll.

programme.title: Portlandia:Mixologist
programme.desc: Fred and Carrie learn about the art of mixology and love as they venture outside of Portland on a quest. Guest stars Andy Samberg, Kumail Nanjiani.

programme.title: Portlandia:Open Relationship

programme.title: Portlandia:You Do You
programme.desc: Sandra discovers she can have it all. Portland adds more lanes to the freeway. Kath & Dave learn the art of taking photo booth pictures.

programme.title: Portlandia:Most Pro City
programme.desc: The Mayor sets out to prove Portland's diversity. Text message drama unfolds during a business meeting. Activists on a hunger strike take a cheat day.

programme.title: Portlandia:Peter Follows P!nk
programme.desc: Peter & Nance interact with celebs on social media. James rides his bike to work. Gil & George say Oh, Hello to Toni & Candace.

programme.title: Portlandia:Long Way Back
programme.desc: The Weirdos lose their trash can, which takes an unexpected journey throughout the city. Malcolm & Kris visit a pediatrician. Fred & Carrie just give up.

programme.title: Portlandia:Rose Route
programme.desc: The Mayor cuts deals all over town to secure the perfect route for the Portland Marathon. Fred & Carrie decide to run to break their addiction to news alerts.

programme.title: Portlandia:Farm
programme.desc: A bohemian couple goes to great lengths to make sure that their restaurant order is ethical and humane. Guest starring Steve Buscemi and Jason Sudeikis.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Adam Cozens - Anyway...Here's Adam Cozens
programme.desc: A hilarious performer, Adam has been seen on IFC’s “The Birthday Boys,” HBO’s “Got No Game,” and TBS’s “Lopez Tonight.” His stand up has been featured on Nickelodeon’s “NickMom,” Hulu’s “West Coast Funnies” “Tell Your Friends: The Concert Film,” “The CoExist Comedy Tour” documentary, “ComedyTime,” as well as heard worldwide on Sirius|XM Radio.

programme.title: Lee Hardin - Not Quite a Grown-Up
programme.desc: Lee Hardin is a comedian known for making bad decisions and his love for Taco Bell.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Jeremy Nunes - Neighborhood Sasq-Watch
programme.desc: Jeremy Nunes has drawn rave reviews from critics for his clever observations, unique storytelling style, and ability to improvise with his audience.

programme.title: Brandon Vestal - Who?
programme.desc: “Brandon Vestal’s low key, deeply personal and honest style has made him a fast favorite in the comedy world, a “Don’t Miss” for college audiences, and a club favorite. He puts on an amazing show and is a definite must see.”

programme.title: Marc Yaffee - Mid-Laugh Crisis
programme.desc: Adopted at birth and confused ever since, Marc takes his audiences on a comedy joyride as he explores his multi-ethnic roots and the culture clashes that fill his world. Marc’s smart but relatable comedy demonstrates a universal appeal that has landed him appearances on PBS, Comics Unleashed, The Latino Laugh Festival and the Showtime special, Goin’ Native. Funny not filthy, Marc serves audiences his original comedy recipe, specially prepared for non- stop laughs. Tasty topics, spicy premises and savory punchlines, are all dished out with a dash of sarcasm and a grain of salt. A regular in Las Vegas, Marc has performed six times overseas for Armed Forces Entertainment and he’s a past winner of Ventura Comedy Festival’s Funniest Person Contest.

programme.title: Collin Moulton - Anti-Animal Vegan
programme.desc: Collin is one of the most fun, personable, and sought after headliners today. He has had his own stand-up special on SHOWTIME, he's been on NICKELODEON, and was recently featured on LAST CALL WITH CARSON DALY. Touring for over 15 years Collin has gained an ease and enjoyment on stage that makes every show worth watching.America knows and loves him. His familiarity and energy engages and relieves the audience before he even speaks. His electric storytelling style makes you care about every topic he explores. Collin's comedy is the release needed from our every day lives. Come needing to laugh tonight, leave wanting to laugh forever!Collin Moulton

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Alex Velluto - Thirsty
programme.desc: Alex Velluto is a stand-up comedian and Diet Coke drinker from Salt Lake City, Utah. He has performed at comedy festivals all over the country including the Boston Comedy Festival, Big Sky Comedy Festival, and the Seattle International Comedy Competition. He was named “Best of Fest” at the Golden Spike Comedy Festival and is the winner of the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival in Ithaca, NY. In 2016, Alex was voted “Best Comedian” by City Weekly Magazine. His debut comedy special “Alex Velluto: Spurious” is currently streaming on Amazon.com.

programme.title: Leland Klassen - More True
programme.desc: Raised on a farm in the heart of Canada, Leland quickly learned that shoveling manure and weeding potatoes, although lucrative, wasnít his passion in life. So with absolutely no clear direction or vision for his future, he did what everyone does when they find themselves in that position - he went to University. He wisely chose his classes based on whichever cute girl happened to catch his attention and after several short years of last minute cramming and late assignments, Leland graduated from the University of Saskatchewan with a degree in Anthropology. As you might have guessed, Lelandís university education opened many doors for him in the years to come, but for some reason he was dissatisfied working for a courier as a night shift stock boy. By this time married and with his first child soon on the way, the most responsible and obvious choice was, of course, to pursue a career in the entertainment industry. Starting off at amateur nights and seedy bars Leland decided right from the beginning that he would remain clean despite what everyone else was doing and as a result over the last 16 years Leland has become recognized as Canadaís premier clean comedian. With his unique intelligence and wit, Leland has carved out quite a niche for himself in the world of entertainment. Using his farm boy charm and handsome (although somewhat inbred) Mennonite good looks, Lelandís clever observations and rich life experiences are brought to life in a one-of-a-kind show. LELANDíS CREDITS: Halifax Comedy Fest 2014, Just for Laughs in Montreal, 1999, 2001, 2004 and 2014, Host of Popcorn TV, Featured on Thou Shalt Laugh 5, Host of Comedy Tournament, Co-Host GMA Canada 2009, 2012 and 2013, Promise Keepers Canada, Episode of the US syndicated comedy series ìBananasî, Two of his own television seriesí on the West Coast, as well as Appeared on numerous other programs across the United States and Canada, such as Comedy Network, CBC Television, YTV, Star TV, Global and Discovery Kids.

programme.title: David Dyer - Further Along Than Anyone Expected
programme.desc: David Dyer has been performing at stand-up at comedy clubs and corporate events for over twenty years. He’s worked with some of the best comics in the industry including Mike Birbiglia, Jim Breuer, and Lewis Black. He’s been a contributing writer to NBC’s Late Night with Jimmy Fallon and ABC’s Politically Incorrect. He’s a regular on the nationally syndicated Bob and Tom Show and often appears on the roster for their “Friends of The Bob and Tom Show” comedy tour. He’s the host of a new web series called Sidecar Sessions where he interviews guests who are sitting in the sidecar of his motorcycle as David pilots the bike around town. David also created and stars in another web series called Pillars with co-star, Kevin Yon. David became an on-call firefighter with Grand Rapids Township in Michigan….his wife is nervous.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Rahn Hortman - Good Game
programme.desc: Rahn credits the earliest influences to his humor to Bill Cosby and Martin Lawrence. Bill Cosby's ability to tackle diverse subject matter without uttering a single curse word, and Martin Lawrence's natural gift of representing the "ordinary guy" combined to form the foundation for Rahn's vision. What resulted is a unique blend of profanity-free banter, with pointed observations about everyday people that leave no one safe.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Chris Voth - Cashmere
programme.desc: Chris Voth is an accomplished comedian, a licensed teacher, and a published author. Voth made his debut late-night television appearance on the Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson. He also appeared in three seasons of NBC's Last Comic Standing and was chosen for the prestigious Great American Comedy Festival. A 15-year comedy veteran, Voth is a past winner of the Denver Comedy Works Competition and has worked with everyone from Dave Chappelle to Larry the Cable Guy to Linda Ronstadt. Voth’s first comedy CD titled "Never Mind the Jim J Bullocks, Here's the Chris Voth" is currently available for purchase. Chris currently balances his performance schedule with his full-time high-school teaching career. You can read his short story, "Stand Up and Deliver," published in the Cream City Review Literary Journal. In it, Chris shares the experiences he had when entering the teaching field after years in stand-up comedy.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Dave Nihill - Documented
programme.desc: Dave is the winner of the prestigious 43rd annual San Francisco Comedy Competition, and runner up in the Moth’s largest US Grandslam storytelling competition.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Costaki Economopoulos - Now That I'm A Grown-up
programme.desc: For 20 years Costaki has been living his dream as a full-time stand up comic. He has written jokes for Bette Midler, Jay Leno, MTV, and BET. You may have seen him on Showtime or heard him on Sirius, but you probably know him best from his regular appearances on the nationally syndicated Bob & Tom Radio Show.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Roxy'' - Brandon helps an overwhelmed family narrow the choices to find the perfect rescue dog for them. Once the Peach family decides on a sweet little puppy, Roxy, it's up to Brandon to break her bad habits.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Coco'' - Brandon has his hands full after rescuing a skittish boarder collie mix named CoCo. After having to survive on the streets of LA, CoCo is extremely fearful of everyone. Brandon teaches her not only to trust, but to help others also in need.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Motu'' - A cancer survivor with a passion for the ocean finds a kindred spirit in Motu, a spunky Maltese mix facing his own physical challenge. But before Motu can sail off into the sunset with Julie, he'll need to hone his kayaking skills with Brandon.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Bandit'' - Brandon hopes to place an intelligent Border Collie mix named Bandit into the home of the Bisaccia family. But the adoption falls into jeopardy when mom, Erika, reveals her own personal battle with dog allergies.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Glory'' - After the tragic loss of her husband, a grandmother reaches out to Brandon in hopes of finding a furry new companion. But before Glory, an overweight Poodle mix, can join the family, she'll need to shape up with the help of Brandon's boot camp.

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Skye'' - A game of trust. With Brandon's help, a skittish White Shepherd mix learns to embrace the world around her. But before Skye settles into her forever home, she'll need to forge an unlikely friendship with her new owner's horse.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Jemma'' - An outgoing German Shepherd/Lab mix named Jemma could be the perfect canine ambassador for one woman's bed and breakfast. But before this seven-month-old puppy can assume her new role, she'll need to check her immaturity at the door.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''New Skills'' - For five lucky shelter dogs, a forever home is right around the corner. But before they can step into their new lives, they'll all need to embrace "new skills."

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Darby'' - A middle school teacher reaches out to Brandon in hopes of adopting her very first dog. But if nine-month-old Darby wants to be the teacher's pet, she'll need to ace the common commands and prove she's ready for a classroom environment.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Lola'' - When conventional training methods fail to pull a timid Welsh terrier mix named Lola out of her shell, Brandon recruits another "Lucky Dog in Training" to build Lola's confidence.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Riley'' - Brandon transforms an "untrainable" two-year-old spaniel mix into one of the most talented agility dogs in Lucky Dog history. But will Riley's high-octane energy level prove too much for his potential mom, who suffers from chronic fatigue syndrome.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Maggie'' - A spaniel mix named Maggie could be the perfect companion for a couple that recently lost their beloved golden retriever. But when Maggie's crippling fear of abandonment fails to respond to training, Brandon must turn to an outside source for help.

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Friendships'' - They're called "Man's Best Friend", but for these five dogs, companionship defies age, size, gender and even species. Today we look back at some of this year's most heartwarming, and surprising, "friendships".

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans - "Skull of Steel Proof / Shock Proof"
programme.desc:
Thom Hunt meets a man who claims to have a skull capable of withstanding extreme forces Li Xin demonstrates this by performing a headstand on the tip of a nine-inch nail. Will MRI show the key to his skull strength?
Thom continues his quest to meet Biba Struger, who claims to be immune to electrocution. Using electrical wires plugged into an electrical socket, Biba uses his body to complete the circuit. Continuing his quest, Thom meets Brian Jackson with his unique lung power, inflating rubber hot water bottles until they explode. Brian attempts a feat beyond comprehension, to lift a 2 tonne truck with lung power. Thom brings in his experts to search for the secret to these amazing power.

programme.title: Erica
programme.desc: Marine biologist Erica has spent the past eleven years researching the smallest life forms in the ocean, phytoplankton. Through Erica’s eyes, the role of these microorganisms in the marine ecosystem is clarified. Her dream is to swim with humpback whales, so David and his team are determined to make it happen.

programme.title: Jess
programme.desc: Environmental philosophy student Jessica is looking to go beyond the surfing experience and see what more the ocean has to offer. Hanli steps up and instructs Jessica in the art of free diving. Her first dive is in a protected cove in a Marine Protected Area in False bay. The episode ends on a high note as Jessica and the crew enjoy an encounter with a pod of pilot whales.

programme.title: Paseka: The Easter Elephant
programme.desc: On Easter morning, a baby elephant is mysteriously abandoned by her herd in the wilds of Botswana’s Okavango Delta. Saved from certain death by a bizarre chain of events, she forces herself into a very unusual, captive elephant herd. This is “Paseka's” story.

programme.title: Life On Us: A Microscopic Safari
programme.desc: Just like planet Earth, our body is composed of diverse landscapes surprising wildlife. This award-winning film offers a unique microscopic safari, encountering the creatures that live, compete, feed, on breed on the surface or in the depths of our body. Some may seem harmful, others are useful and even essential to our survival, but all participate in the biological balance of the human body.

programme.title: Monwabisi
programme.desc: Monwa’s life is tied to the sea. However, his relationship to the marine environment is based in fear. David and the crew aim to help him overcome this fear by getting him into the water. Monwa learns to free dive, and once the crew is satisfied that he can handle more, Monwa takes the plunge and swims with blue sharks in an underwater canyon off the coast of the Cape of Good Hope.

programme.title: Africa's Primeval Oceans
programme.desc: The scene is the southern tip of Africa. Just off shore, two very different seas meet to form one of the most diverse marine environments on earth. The meeting of icy Atlantic and warm Indian waters not only affect life underwater, they are giant forces that shape the land, climate, and all its creatures. The Portuguese explorer Bartholomew Dias and his crew called it the Cape of Storms.

programme.desc: Full Size Run is Sole Collector's weekly sneaker talk and debate show featuring co-hosts Brendan Dunne, Matt Welty, and Trinidad James, and this week they're joined by Marcus Jordan, the CEO of Trophy Room and Michael Jordan's son. He tells crazy stories about his father, shows off never-seen-before Air Jordans, and talks about running a sneaker store.

programme.title: Lil Tjay Tried to Spend $20,000 on Sneakers
programme.desc: Full Size Run is Sole Collector's weekly sneaker talk and debate show featuring co-hosts Brendan Dunne, Matt Welty, and Trinidad James, and this week they're joined by Bronx rapper LiL Tjay and he talks about trying to buy his friends $20k worth of sneakers, his favorite sneakers growing up, and his love of designer sneakers.

programme.title: How BMX Star Nigel Sylvester Landed His Own Air Jordan
programme.desc: Full Size Run is Sole Collector's weekly sneaker talk and debate show featuring co-hosts Brendan Dunne, Matt Welty, and Trinidad James, and this week they're joined by pro BMX rider Nigel Sylvester for the Season 5 premiere to talk about how he got into sneakers, how he got his own Air Jordan and Nike SB collaborations, and more.

programme.title: Fat Joe Reveals His Crazy Sneaker Plugs
programme.desc: Full Size Run is Sole Collector's weekly sneaker talk and debate show featuring co-hosts Brendan Dunne, Matt Welty, and Trinidad James, and this week they're joined by Fat Joe to talk about how he got his exclusive Nike sneakers, the time Mike Bibby choked him out for stealing shoes, and to tell wild sneaker stories.

programme.title: Danny Brown Explains Why He Got Kicked Off Nike HQ
programme.desc: Full Size Run is Sole Collector's weekly sneaker talk and debate show featuring co-hosts Brendan Dunne, Matt Welty, and Trinidad James, and this week they're joined by rapper Danny Brown to talk about how he got into sneakers, his love for the Nike Monarch, why he got kicked off Nike's main headquarters, and the unfortunate accident he had in his Big Baller Brand sneakers.

programme.title: Laura Stylez vs Anna Bediones in a Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of Sneaker Battle From Home, we invite the ladies to throw down on the battle stage! Radio host, Laura Stylez, says her sneaker game can hang with the best of them, meanwhile we also invited our first ever international battler, Anna Bediones, to come showcase some of her exquisite footwear. These ladies definitely held their own, showcasing a variety of stylish and exclusive sneakers!

programme.title: Tyron Woodley Crowns the West Coast's Best Rapper | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: UFC Champion Tyron Woodley is also known for dabbing in music himself, so his deep knowledge of hip hop came as a surprise to no one. The Ferguson, Missouri native stopped by Complex Brackets to pick who he thinks is the best West Coast rapper and was faced with some difficult choices between legendary figures with some newer rappers trying to make a name for themselves. Watch him struggle to pick between Snoop vs Ice Cube, Tupac vs E-40 and Schoolboy Q vs Too Short.

programme.title: Tinashe Wants All the Smoke in Quarantine
programme.desc: Check out the second episode featuring Tinashe, as she reveals how she's taking on all "challenges" from Tik Tok to Instagram and PS4 while quarantined!

programme.title: T.I. Breaks Down What the Harris Household Is Binge-Watching
programme.desc: T.I. reveals his favorite Verzuz battles on IG Live, the story behind his podcast "Expeditiously With Tip T.I. Harris," and how his family doesn't like to lose.

programme.title: Foodgod on the New 'Kardashians' Season and His Delivery Go-tos
programme.desc: Foodgod Jonathan Cheban reveals his favorite food deliveries during the pandemic and his new seafood delivery service 'Oceanbox.' He also reflects on how watching himself on KUWTK this season has reminded him of his regular life.

programme.title: Lil Yachty vs Conceited in a Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this heavyweight Sneaker Battle From Home episode, we put "Mr. Slow It Down I Just Dissed You", Conceited, up against rapper, singer, songwriter, Lil Yachty, in a 5 round sneaker battle of epic proportions! I won't spoil anything for the viewers but a lot of back and forth took place along with tons of hilarity! Watch the episode and let us know who won this battle!

programme.title: Allen Iverson Reminds Us Why He's The Best Dressed NBA Player Ever | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On this week's episode of "Tunnel Takedown," we're live from ComplexCon 2019 in Long Beach with special guest and NBA style legend Allen Iverson! In addition to discussing which NBA players were the best and worst dressed of the week, we take a look at some of A.I's past fits while in the league and discuss the influence he still has on current player's fashion. Iverson also tells stories about the backlash he received for not sticking to the NBA's former uniform dress code, plus more!

programme.title: James Harden's Cozy Fit Costs as Much as a New Car | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On this episode of 'Tunnel Takedown,' the hosts talk PJ Tucker's latest outfit, how players tone down their fits in smaller cities, the '90s Starter jacket trend still being in style today, and Racks Hogan explains his beef with Amiri. They even try to guess the costs of outfits from superstars like James Harden and Ben Simmons. The numbers may surprise you.

programme.title: NikeStories vs Nick Engvall in a Sneaker Battle From Home! | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of Sneaker Battle From Home, we put two OG's in the sneaker space against one another. In one corner we have Drew Hammell, also known as NikeStories, and in the other corner we have founder of "Sneaker History" and veteran writer in the sneaker blog space, Nick Engvall. These two go head to head in a versatile five round battle! We get to see some classic gems, we haven't seen in a while. Check it out for yourselves and let us know who won this battle!

programme.title: Josh Luber of StockX vs Charlotte Hornets Bismack Biyombo in a Sneaker Battle | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: (Episode shot on 5/26/2020) On this episode of #LIFEATCOMPLEX Presents Sneaker Battle, we have a "David vs Goliath" battle! In one corner he is the co-founder of one of the largest online sneaker marketplaces in the world, StockX's very own Josh Luber is here to battle! And in the other corner, he is the biggest competitor we've had so far, literally! Standing in at 6 foot 8 inches tall, center for the Charlotte Hornets, Bismak Biyombo is here to throw down in the sneaker gauntlet!

programme.title: NBA Champion Matt Barnes Reveals His Worst Dressed Teammate | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: Welcome back to the premiere episode of "Tunnel Takedown" season 2 hosted by Racks Hogan Complex's vet stylist stoner, Matt Barnes 14-year NBA tunnel vet, NBA champion and hooping stoner and Gia Seo Creative Director and sockfluencer as they break down the best and worst fits from some of your favorite NBA players walking the tunnel.

programme.title: Kelly Oubre Channels His Rockstar Energy while Chris Paul's Fit Flops | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week's episode of "Tunnel Takedown" discusses players like PJ Tucker experimenting with patterns and new brands, Kelly Oubre's latest rockstar fit, overalls having a comeback thanks to players like Russell Westbrook, and the problem with wearing too many graphics at once. Our host Matt Barnes even takes a look at some fits from his playing days.

programme.title: Joe La Puma Breaks Down How To Pair Sneakers with Your Fits | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: Joe La Puma joins the panel this week for the season two finale to discuss how to find the perfect pair of sneakers to pair with your outfit. The hosts also crown their best dressed players of the season so far, and discuss the personal styles of NBA superstars like LeBron James and Giannis Antetokounmpo. Racks Hogan, NBA champion Matt Barnes, and Creative Director Gia Seo also give their picks for the worst tunnel outfits of the year thus far.

programme.title: Marcus Jordan Says New Air Jordan Project Is On The Way | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: Son of NBA legend Michael Jordan, Marcus, stops by this week on 'Tunnel Takedown.' He teases an upcoming Air Jordan project with his store Trophy Room coming in 2020, and gives his thoughts on the latest fits from stars like Kemba Walker and PJ Tucker. Host Racks Hogan, NBA champion Matt Barnes, and Creative Director Gia Seo also discuss Carmelo Anthony's style to celebrate his recent return to the NBA and roast some more of the league's most flagrant fits.

programme.title: Racks Loses It Over Russell Westbrook and JaVale McGee Needs a Shirt | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week, Racks Hogan, Mouse Jones and Kalysse Anthony break down their favorite looks of the week and get into a heated discussion over Russell Westbrook. Plus, renowned stylist Derek Roche previews the upcoming style trend while on the set of French Montana's new video. Then, Kalysse walks us through the do's and don'ts of Dopp kits and the hosts go in on JaVale McGee's bold fit.

programme.title: TMarkGotKickss Vs WhoisHeck In A Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of #LIFEATCOMPLEX Presents Sneaker Battle, we are putting two acquaintances against one another. In one corner we have the Chief Operating Officer of PrivateLabelNYC, Hector Aponte, taking on the outfit grid king, Terrel Marcus aka TMarkGotKickss! Both battlers displayed a wide variety of hyped and exclusive sneakers you won't see often! Check out the episode and let us know who won this battle?!

programme.title: Showtime: A Coming Of Age Football Story
programme.desc: A powerful story of the 2019 Parkway North Junior Vikings 8th Grade Team as they strive to become 3 time champions. Despite their differences while learning life lessons through the game of football join together as one team, one vision, one community.

programme.title: Persianality
programme.desc: In this Revry Original series, hilarity ensues when married couple Bijan and Fereshteh Shoorkhakianian visit Palm Springs. Whether it's sitting by the pool, eating dinner, or getting a couple's massage - there's no denying that this love is lavish.

programme.title: The Q Agenda
programme.desc: S3 E4 | In this episode of The Q Agenda, we sit down with renowned publicist Howard Bragman to discuss his upbringing and the upcoming election. Writer-director duo Leita Solomon and Wes Akuobi talk about their controversial film, "The Cypher." Plus, we discuss the departure of Vanderpump Rules cast members after racist comments.

programme.title: Gay Positive
programme.desc: Gay Positive educates viewers about the controversial ban on queer men donating blood in the USA. The film captures opinions of people from all walks of life, asking, If you were in need of blood would you take it from a queer? Organizations are forced to reject healthy individuals from donating. During the filming of this documentary, Mexico and the UK lifted their ban, while the FDA insists it remain. Through insightful conversations with Laverne Cox, Rutanya Alda, Blanche Baker, Jim Colucci, Frank DeCaro, Trapper Felides, Tiago Grade, Carly Hughes, Chelsey Keding, Yetta Kurland, Lisa Lampanelli, Vincent Leggett, Danny Logan, Dave McRee, Anthony Lee Medina, Eric Millegan, Kaitlin Monte, Tym Moss, Garry Novikoff, Athena Reich, and Justin Luke Zirilli Gay Positive raises public awareness on the potential benefits of lifting the ban.

programme.title: Gay Mean Girls

Along the way, both mother and son find support in their communities, reminding us that families are not only given, but chosen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After shooting his victims in the head, the killer staged the scene, placed the incriminating evidence into a plastic bag and tossed it into the river.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In a tragic twist of fate, just days after the woman sold her home and moved to a modest trailer, a fire took both the trailer and her life. But the autopsy proved this was no accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A security guard disappeared from his post without a trace his remains were found a year later in a remote camp site.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college senior was found raped and murdered near an unpaved footpath used by students to walk from one side of campus to the other.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man riding a bicycle was fatally injured, and police believed he was the victim of a hit-and-run accident. Tiny clues found at the scene created a picture of the vehicle which struck him and led police to its driver.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A married couple decided to escape the cold of winter with a mini-vacation in Key West. The wife went missing, and police searched every square inch of the island, they found nothing but a pair of sandals which might have belonged to her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide - but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of an Air Force officer was found dead in her bed with a plastic laundry bag near her face. Further investigation proved that the scene had been staged. Her death wasn't an accident, it was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a fire destroyed most of a home and a young boy went missing, police organized the largest search in the history of their small town. First the boy's backpack was discovered five miles from home, and then his body was found 50 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: highway patrolman was dispatched to what he thought would be a routine traffic accident until he looked in the car. While he had no formal training in forensic science, he had seen hundreds of accidents - but never as much blood as this.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decomposed body of a young woman was discovered in a Bakersfield irrigation canal. If there was trace evidence, it had been washed away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body - but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Drowning Closet, Ostrich Eggs, Merry Go Round" - Water rises in a glass closet as contestants struggle to unlock the door and escape.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Scooter Plank, Deer Jewels/100 Year Old Egg Nog, Trapped Under The Ice" - Contestants must ride a motorized scooter across a narrow plank 100 feet above the ground and devour roasted reindeer parts. Host: Joe Rogan.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Helicopter Bodt Drop, Slug Bugs and Bile, Build-A-Bridge" - For the first stunt contestants have to hang from a helicopter skit and drop into the water below as the helicopter flew over a buoy. Once in the water, they would have to retrieve a flag from underneath the buoy, swim with it to a platform, and clip it on a flagpole. Stunt two has them slug it out as they have to eat 10 live slugs and drink a shot of cow bile. For the final, contestants have to build a bridge on two cables from the top of one building to another and climb across the wooden slats provided moving them along the way. The contestant across the fastest would be the Fear Factor Champion and win $50K.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Inverted Heli Hang, Horse Rectum, Sky Walker" - Contestants have to complete the following stunts: Inverted heli hang/Horse rectum/Sky walker.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Barrel Rolling, Rat Transfer, Car Jump into Pond" - Can the contestants master the barrel roll, the dead rat race and the suicidal drive in the fastest time?

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Spin Cycle, Breakfast of Champions, Stilt Walking" - Contestants must consume balut -- eggs containing partially developed duck embryos -- as well as liquefied liver and dead silk worms in brine.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Save Your Spouse, Roach Transfer, Couples Hang" - Four couples compete a member of each couple tries to free the mate from a box submerged in water contestants must remove roaches from a candy box using only their mouths.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Ferris Wheel, Fear Factor Pizza, Water Platform" - After a "blizzard" hits, contestants must balance on a spinning Ferris wheel while dining on pizza topped with bile and blood.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Bobbing in Blood, Tomato Hornworm, Skunk Crawl" - Contestants must bob for objects submerged in 50 gallons of cow blood players must eat tomato hornworms and then gather skunk carcasses from inside a darkened tunnel.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Vertical Two Square, Eel Tank, Heli Rodeo" - Female contestants must transfer electric eels from one container to another players must straddle a bull-like object as it swings from a helicopter over a lake.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond hosts another episode of TV's stupidest, brightest and most insane game show. In this series, the obstacles have been made bigger and brasher than ever, ensuring bigger bumps, crunches, smashes, and splashes.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty contestants take on one of television's largest and most extreme obstacle courses in order to win 10,000 pounds and get to 'The Final'.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard's co-host Amanda Byram is course-side in Buenos Aires as 20 foolhardy Brits tackle the purpose-built Argentinian course. There is a 10,000 pound prize for the winner and the additional plaudit of being crowned the Total Wipeout champion. To get there all the winner has to do is master the Sucker Punch, the Big Red Balls, Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, twenty intrepid contestants – male and female, young and old, fit and not-so-fit – take on four grueling, but wildly funny obstacle courses to win the title of the seventh Wipeout Champion and the grand cash prize.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Throughout this season, contestants have fallen, bounced and swung to win the prize, but only seven of them could achieve it. This is the last episode of the season and the seven previous winners compete to be crowned Champion of Champions. This time they face games like The Qualifier, The Crash Mountain, Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the 'Legends Special' and today all the worst but funniest competitors from the last three series have been invited back to have another go on the TV show. This time they have invited the 'Dodgeball Men' that appear during 'The Qualifier' game and, as you might remember, they throw dodgeballs at contestants while they attempt to cross the pontoons over water.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond presents the annual Total Wipeout trophy-athon where they celebrate the highs, the lows and the biggest splashes from the whole season. The presenter starts with the new 'Best Slip and Trip Award' and will be showing the top five, and the winner for each category. Don't miss this special episode!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the first 'Celebrity Special' of the season. You will see how ten celebrities compete and risk everything in the name of charity. However, this time, all of them face 'The Qualifier' and 'The Crash Mountain'. Celebrities are Michaela Strachan, Siân Lloyd, Joe Absolom, Antony Costa, Kate Lawler, Ninia Benjamin, Jeff Brazier, Iwan Thomas, and Tony Tobin.

programme.title: Beyond the Grid S3:E2 "Hunting High Country Deer"
programme.desc: Ditch the heavy packs for llamas on this DIY public land high country mule deer hunt.

programme.title: Beyond the Grid S3:E3 "My First Bull"
programme.desc: Hunt public land elk with John and Dan Pickar. After days of average bulls, they find a giant!

programme.title: Benelli Presents: Donnie Vincent’s Winds of Adak
programme.desc: In November of 2019, explorer and hunter Donnie Vincent traveled to Adak Island, Alaska. Located at the westernmost end in the Aleutian chain, Adak is wilderness with the exception of a now-abandoned naval base that once housed more than 6,000 people. Winds of Adak chronicles Donnie’s exploration of the island, a hauntingly desolate abandoned military outpost and three unique hunts—caribou, ptarmigan and sea ducks—as the unforgiving elements, the terrain and the Bering Sea test both man and equipment.

programme.title: Reel Animals S14:E13 "Summer Days"
programme.desc: Capt. Mike Anderson heads out to Crystal River, FL for a hot summer bite.

programme.title: Reel Life Adventures S1:E3 "Florida Pompano and Jet-Skis at Isla Bella"
programme.desc: Tucker and JC Carlson travel deep into the Gulf of Mexico to fish for Florida Pompano and Cobia. They also visit Isla Bella Beach Resort to play a competitive game of cornhole and ride jet-skis.

programme.title: Reel Life Adventures S1:E4 "From Kite Fishing to Kiteboarding "
programme.desc: Tucker and JC Carlson travel to Everglades National Park to fish the yearly tarpon migration. They also find giant schools of permit along the way. Tucker and JC also visit Grassy Flats Resort to learn how to kiteboard with Matt Sexton. .

programme.title: Uncharted Waters with Peter Miller S4:E3 "Peter and his daughter Emily, target Mahi Mahi, Peacock Bass, Largemouth Bass and Tarpon in Miami."
programme.desc: Peter and his daughter Emily catch Mahi Mahi offshore, Peacock and Largemouth Bass in their backyard and travel to downtown miami to catch Tarpon and are treated to an epic sashimi dinner at Uchi Miami with James Beard award winning chef, Tyson Cole.

programme.title: Uncharted Waters with Peter Miller S4:E4
programme.desc: Peter travels 220 miles by boat to Harbour Island, Bahamas trolling for big kingfish, live baiting for tuna and bottom fish for big mutton snapper along the reef. Afterwards they take a swim with and hand feed the famous Green Sea Turtles and cut up some tuna on the way in for some sunset sashimi. PART 1

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S12:E1 "Call Rutting Bucks: 190” Giant Comes Running, Public Land Team Effort"
programme.desc: Bill weighs in on his strategies for getting bucks to come into range in late October.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S12:E2 "Big Shed Antlers, When to Snort-Wheeze"
programme.desc: On this week's episode, we first join Josh Sparks and Kaleb Greiner shed hunting in Iowa. They've picked up some good antlers including two bucks they know well. Then we join Jared Mills who discusses why frost seeding clover can be so productive and how to do it. Finally, Bill covers a hunt from 2008 with his good friend, Mike Sawyer, where a snort wheeze call was the key to a successful harvest.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S12:E3 "Off-Beat Tips for November Success, Shed Hunting"
programme.desc: On this week's episode we start things off with Bill performing soil tests on the farm. He explains both how he does these tests and why it's important to do them to get the most out of your land. Next we join Drake Lamb who gives an update on a buck he presumed was dead. Finally, we join Jared Mills who updates us on some of the antlers he and Mike found on their river farm. He also covers a successful hunt from November of 2013, when he snuck in at midnight to hang a stand. Here is a link to the soil test kits: https://www.frigidforage.com/hot-buys/soil-test-kit/

programme.title: Red Rising S6:E7 "Sand Creed Whitetails: Take 1"
programme.desc: Eric and Jason join Cody Lee and family in Texas at Sand Creek Whitetails for some unbelievable whitetail action and even finer accommodations.

Season XIII WPT Player of the Year Mukul Pahuja sits in third chip position, trailing chip leader Jonathan Jaffe and Ratharam Sivagnanam.

programme.title: World Poker Tour Season 13 Episode 14
programme.desc: Only Jonathan Jaffe and Ratharam Sivagnanam stand between Season XIII WPT Player of the Year Mukul Pahuja and his first World Poker Tour title. The winner of WPT Montreal at Playground Poker Club earns more than $400,000, a pair of Monster® 24K® headphones, a Hublot® King Power Unico Watch, and a seat into the season-ending WPT World Championship.

programme.title: World Poker Tour Season 13 Episode 15
programme.desc: The World Poker Tour returns to the legendary Bellagio in Las Vegas, Nevada, where 586 entries compete for their share of the more than $5.6 million prize pool. Season XII WPT champion Mohsin Charania is at the final table, looking to etch his name once again on the coveted WPT Champions Cup™, and he is joined by BLUFF.com WPT Ones to Watch Garrett Greer and professionals Brett Shaffer, Ryan Julius, Ryan Fee, and Tobias Reinkemeier.

programme.title: World Poker Tour Season 13 Episode 16

programme.title: World Poker Tour Season 13 Episode 18

programme.title: World Poker Tour Season 13 Episode 19

programme.title: World Poker Tour Season 13 Episode 20

Science expert Dan Souza discusses the importance of taking your time when you make an emulsion. Finally, Julia and Bridget prepare pão de queijo.

programme.title: Pasta Quick and Easy
programme.desc: Every cook needs quick pasta recipes in their repertoire. Pasta with garlic and oil is perhaps the most famous quick pasta dish. It starts with ingredients on hand-garlic, good olive oil, hot red pepper flakes-and turns them into something special and uncommonly good.

programme.title: Hearty Soups
programme.desc: On a cold day, few dishes are as comforting as a hearty soup-unless it turns out starchy or gluey. Watch as we make thick and creamy versions of two of our favorites: ham and split pea, and rustic potato-leek.

programme.title: The Pancakes Show
programme.desc: Few recipes deliver so much pleasure for so little work as pancakes. The batter comes together in minutes, and the cooking time is brief. Why, then, do most Americans never make pancakes from scratch?

programme.title: Easy Sheet Cakes
programme.desc: A sheet cake is like a two-layer cake with training wheels-it's hard to fall off. But sheet cakes are still cakes. They can still turn out dry, sticky, or flavorless, and on occasion they can even sink in the middle. The test kitchen decided to tackle two popular sheet cakes-carrot and chocolate-and produce simple recipes that would deliver superior results.

programme.title: An Indian Dinner
programme.desc: The test kitchen prepares two Indian favorites: chicken biryani and mulligatawny soup.

programme.title: Quicker Pasta
programme.desc: Sure, raw tomato sauces are fast, but if the sauce is watery and bland, who cares? Likewise, asparagus-based pasta sauces are often bland and boring. In this episode we keep things simple while avoiding these common problems.

programme.title: Eggs for Brunch
programme.desc: Excellent egg dishes shouldn't require the talents of a short-order cook. Our hearty frittata is just as filling as an omelet, but a whole lot easier to prepare and serve. We also uncover the formula for the ideal quiche filling and deliver a tender, buttery pastry crust filled with moist, smooth custard.

programme.title: Pulled Pork and Cornbread
programme.desc: We wanted to develop a recipe for pulled pork that rivals that of the best barbecue joints but won't be an all-day affair. We pair the pork with another barbecue classic-cornbread.

programme.title: Dark Chocolate Desserts
programme.desc: In this episode, we set out to develop ultimate versions of two favorite chocolate desserts: chocolate mousse and chocolate cupcakes.

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - The Fishing Village
programme.desc: Martin calls on the fishermen in the Coloane Village on Macau and feasts on the fruit of their labour including a unique “Hanging Fish”. This episode's recipes include: Shanghainese Wok-Seared Fish in Wine Sauce, Black Bean Sauce Clams with Fresh Basil, and Cracked Crab in Ginger-Wine Sauce.

programme.title: A Taste of History - Recipes in the Rainforest
programme.desc: The natural beauty and unique foods of St. Lucia are explored. Chef Walter Staib learns some native creole language and helps prepare unique and traditional St. Lucian fare in the tropical forest of this island nation.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - The Rusted Crow The Jamaican Pot Detroit Cookie Co.
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Nick Blaszczyk, Debbie Wynn and Avery Dvongowski, who review hearty American, vegetarian and vegan dishes at the Rusted Crow authentic homemade Caribbean specialties at the Jamaican Pot and fresh, made-from-scratch cookies and sweets at the Detroit Cookie Company.

programme.title: Graham Kerr's Kitchen - Chile, Cheese and Chicken Enchiladas
programme.desc: Chicken Breast, mild chile peppers, onion and cheese are wrapped in tortillas and topped with simple red and green reduced sauces. Black beans, cilantro and chile pepper enchiladas and topped with cheese.

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Waianae Retreat
programme.desc: “Hawaii Cooks” visits Ihilani Resort and Spa to find the complete spa and cuisine experience. The resort’s spa and cuisine program work together to create a healthful and rejuvenating experience for the guest. The resort's chef, Mark Adair, works with guests to develop menus and recipes that can also be prepared at home.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Fried Oysters with Tartar Sauce II & Boiled Sweet Potatoes
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to prepare and cook Fried Oysters with Tartar Sauce II & Boiled Sweet Potatoes!

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Fettuccine with Cream Sauce
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking fettuccine with cream sauce, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: From Scratch - Whole Hog
programme.desc: Today, Chef Joe visits a rum distillery and celebrates his birthday by roasting a whole pig.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - The Long Walk
programme.desc: In this episode, Cecilia joins Laurence Jossel, chef and owner of Nopa. Like Cecilia, South African-born Jossel came a long way to open a restaurant in San Francisco. Cecilia shows Laurence how to make “beggar’s chicken,” a whole, stuffed chicken wrapped in lotus leaves and then clay, and baked for at least two hours.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - Meatballs for Life
programme.desc: Nick illuminates on the art of making meatballs and the pure joy that a handcrafted meatball can bring to life. Dishes Include: Meatballs Ammugghiate (Mixed Up Meatballs) / Meatballs Agglassatu (Meatballs with Marsala and Onion Sauce) / Chicken Meatballs in Parmesan Cream Sauce.

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Make Mine Mussels / Prepara le mie cozze
programme.desc: Mary Ann travels to cold waters off the Gulf of Maine to reap the harvest of Gary Moretti’s Bangs Island Mussels. First up, keep it simple, with a variety of tangy, tasty, Gary’s Awesome Aiolis. Then Mary Ann combines her signature potato salad with plump, succulent musses to create a unique and most memorable Mussel Potato Salad.

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - Tea House Foods
programme.desc: Martin visits a 24-hour teahouse in Singapore and introduces Chef Susan Tieng, one of the few women chefs in Singapore. This episode's recipes include: “Steamed Buns” with “Buddha Bun Vegetarian Filling”, Shrimp and Tropical Fruit Rolls, and Golden Baked Buns with Shrimp-Scallop Filling.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Primal Grill For A Crowd
programme.desc: Cook indoors and you often cook solo. Light a grill and you cook for a crowd. This show focuses on grilling for parties.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Panzanella
programme.desc: Italians make this bread and vegetable salad in the summer with fresh tomatoes and garlic. We show how to make it all year long, with a springtime asparagus panzanella, a classic summer version, and with veal medallions to serve as a main course. We'll tour Main Street, St. Helena, and see some of the valley's most charming stores and restaurants.

programme.title: Lidias Italian Table - Pasta
programme.desc: Lidia shares her technique for making a basic marinara, enthusiastically immersing herself in sauce making Lidia’s way. She then prepares two faorite pasta dishes: a seafood vermicelli with fresh clams and scallops and a parchment wrapped, baked ziti with mozzarella, marinara and fresh basil. Tutti a tavola! She commands, and we follow joyfully.

programme.title: Infusion - Breakfast
programme.desc: Today on Infusion, we’re eating delicious breakfasts.

programme.title: Julia & Jacques Cooking at Home - Soufflés
programme.desc: Julia and Jacques demonstrate the art, and the adventure, of the Soufflé. Julia extends the classic cheese soufflé to super-height…and Jacques creates a light, fluffy, flavorful scallop and cheese soufflé in a large casserole. For dessert, a chocolate soufflé and cream roulade. Twinkies were never this good!

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of Central America - The Place Where Time Began
programme.desc: Dr. Jago Cooper explores the ancient civilization of Teotihuacan that exploded into a position of dominance in the ancient Americas almost 2000-years ago.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Winter Wonderland
programme.desc: In in Banff, Alberta, Canada, Philippe heads to the Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise for a snowshoeing expedition before climbing a frozen waterfall.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Cultural Science
programme.desc: Phillipe explores Hawaii, Florida and the Pacific Northwest, paddling on a 6-man canoe, using plants as tools and food in the harsh terrain of the everglades and discovering the importance of salmon conservation.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Bahamas
programme.desc: In the Bahamas, Philippe gets up close with Great Hammerhead sharks. Then we join a professional free diver to get a look at the world's deepest saltwater blue hole.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Predatory Myths
programme.desc: We join the shark research team at the University of Miami for two days of shark studies before Philippe visits an antivenom lab home to hundreds of venomous snakes who use defense mechanisms to scare threats away.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Animal Migrations
programme.desc: From Hawaii to the Rocky Mountains and Delaware, we follow the paths of animal migrations. Philippe joins a humpback whale research team before seeing how Jackson, Wyoming accommodates thousands of elk that migrate to this area each winter.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Planet Rescue
programme.desc: This week we see examples of people making a difference to help our planet. From a Turtle Rescue and Rehabilitation center in North Carolina to Olympic National Park the planet heals itself through temperate rainforests that help to filter air pollution.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - South Carolina
programme.desc: Philippe joins the Department of Natural Resources to tag tiger sharks in Port Royal Sound. From there it's the shoreline of Port Royal Sound to examine ecosystem indicators through three different species of crab.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Insects
programme.desc: Philippe heads to the University of Texas to see how research helping to control invasive fire ant populations then wrap up at the University of Pennsylvania to see how researchers study disease transmission of mosquitoes.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Glacier National Park
programme.desc: This week we head to the beautiful landscape of Glacier National Park. Philippe heads out to uncover insect fossils dating back 45 million years. Then we look at the intricate geology of the park itself.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Nature’s Classroom
programme.desc: Philippe heads to Key Largo to join a high school class getting up close with local sea grass habitats. From there it's up to the Pacific Northwest to see how volunteers use camera traps to keep tabs on elusive animals.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Natural Disasters
programme.desc: We see how science helps us prepare for natural disasters. Philippe heads to the University of Miami to see their incredible SUSTAIN lab which simulate a category 5 hurricane. Then it's off to the mountains of Alberta to learn about avalanche safety.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Taking Flight
programme.desc: Philippe joins a researcher to go into Congaree National Park in South Carolina to catch and tag local bats. We then look at the flight patterns and tendencies of wood storks.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Microscopic World
programme.desc: This week we look at our microscopic world. Philippe heads to the University of Texas to break down the microscopic world of sand and then he's off to USC to study some of the smallest organisms in the ocean.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Dramatic Landscapes
programme.desc: Cousteau takes us to the American mid-West to see how wildlife in Yellowstone copes with the harsh winter, then we head to a Pacific island to explore some of the tallest sea cliffs in the world before venturing into the Canadian wilderness.

programme.title: Vintage Tech Hunters - Bohus and Shaun…Buy a Jukebox
programme.desc: During a road trip in Southern California, Bohus and Shaun find a vintage jukebox in dire need of repair. They take it to Los Angeles, to have it restored to mint condition. While in LA, they also hunt for vintage tech at local flea market and an e-waste recycling facility.

programme.title: Tiny House Hunting:Going Tiny in Tampa Bay
programme.desc: Joel and Kelly want to cut costs by going tiny.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Ceiling Fan, Bonsai
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner replace an undersized ceiling fan with a more appropriate one. Kevin, Tom, Richard and Roger ask ""What Is It?"" Later, Roger visits a bonsai nursery to learn the art of sculpting trees.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Lightning, Sink Filter
programme.desc: Kevin and Roger meet with Meteorologist Jim Cantore to discuss Jim's biggest weather fear‰Û_ÌãÌ¨lightning. Roger heads to Orlando to see a lightning protection system installed. Richard helps a homeowner install a reverse osmosis filter for drinking water. And the guys ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Lighting, Water Main
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron heads to Cleveland to install some landscape lighting. Kevin, Tom, Richard and Roger ask ""What Is It?"" Then Richard replaces a water main shutoff.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Mailbox, Reuse Door
programme.desc: Roger helps a homeowner replace a mailbox that was damaged by a snowplow. Kevin shares some information about window anatomy. Tom helps a homeowner reuse an old door in a new opening. And the guys ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Ask TOH | Noisy Heat, New Lights
programme.desc: Tom and Kevin discuss kitchen island dimensions. Richard helps a homeowner quiet a noisy baseboard heating system. The guys ask, ""What Is It?"" Later Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner add light to a kitchen by install three new recessed cans.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Houseplants, US Flag
programme.desc: Roger heads to Maine to help a homeowner plant an indoor tropical garden with plants from Jamaica. Richard, Roger, Kevin and Tom ask ""What Is It?"" Richard shows how to change the temperature on water heaters. Then Tom and Kevin built an American flag out of reclaimed wood.

programme.title: Ask TOH | EV Charger, New Sink
programme.desc: Electrician Scott Caron helps a homeowner install an electric vehicle charger next to his house. The guys ask, ""What Is It?"" Then, Richard helps a homeowner install a new kitchen sink and faucet.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Thermostat, Solar
programme.desc: Roger teaches Kevin about lengths to consider when mowing the lawn. Richard travels to Pittsburgh to install a thermostat that interfaces with a smartphone to save energy and money. Ross Trethewey walks Kevin through the installation of a photovoltaic solar array on the barn. And Kevin, along with Tom, Richard and Roger ask, ""What Is It?"

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | 35 Years of This Old House
programme.desc: In celebration of 35 years of This Old House, we look back at all that's changed in the last 35 years, and also what hasn't: our commitment to delivering trusted ideas and information to empower homeowners. This season begins in Boston's oldest neighborhood, Charlestown. Kevin and Norm highlight Charlestown's historical importance, from colonial times through WWII. Our new project is part of a cluster of 1850s-era Greek Revival houses tucked into the backside of Bunker Hill. Homeowner Angela Daigle shows Kevin the period feel and features of her home that she loves, but also the outdated kitchen and poor organization of space that she'd like to improve. Upstairs, Tom Silva shows Norm the spaces that will be getting minimal work: an existing guest room, guest bath, and living room. But one level up, on the third floor, it will likely be a full gut to give Angela a better master suite with additional living space, assuming the City approves the plan to enlarge the existing dormers. Out back, Roger shows Kevin the sad state of the crumbling retaining walls. Then Kevin finds Richard formulating a plan for the basement. Norm stops in next door to meet Maggie Boone to see how she recently addressed a lot of the same issues that Angela faces by renovating her own row house. And Norm and Tom test for lead paint before beginning demo on the first floor, as downstairs, Kevin, Richard and mason Mark McCullough start digging into the project.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Brick Rowhouse Blues
programme.desc: Kevin arrives to find Tom solving a major problem with the house: The exterior walls are bowing out from the weight of the roof over 160 years. His solution: build a structural wall inbound of the brick, lash the brick to the structure with threaded rods and epoxy, and then parge the whole thing. In the basement, news is brighter: Richard shows Kevin the result of two weeks of hand digging and a week of rough plumbing. The floor is down several inches, the sewer line tucked neatly in the floor, and the radiant heat/insulation system is currently going in. On the third floor, Norm shows Kevin how the roof has been under-structured since it was originally built. The structure they added in the 1980s helped, but it still needs more. Tom joins to get the first of two massive LVLs tucked into the pockets in the brick sidewalls, and fastened in place. To see how it's holding up, Norm revisits the townhouse we renovated in Charlestown 14 years ago. Back at our house, Tom shows Kevin how he's going to open up the back wall for the new bump out. It starts with using two temporary steel "needles" through the reinforced rear wall to hold the weight of the house while a new steel beam is inserted. Then, the bricks can come down one by one to make a small new addition for the breakfast area.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Bridge to Charlestown
programme.desc: Richard gets up close and personal with one of Charlestown's most iconic structures-the Zakim Bridge-by talking with the structural engineer on the project, Ted Zoli. At the project house, Kevin finds the front of the building obscured by scaffolding it will be used to replace the failing asphalt roof, and also to build the dormer, if approval comes in from the City. Inside, Tom shows Kevin how he'll have to modify the old chimney for the new gas fireplace units, and they see the framing progress, including the new bump out for the breakfast area. The third floor master suite is all framed up, save the dormer, which is still in regulatory limbo. In the backyard, mason Mark McCullough presents options for rebuilding the decaying retaining walls at different price points. Then, they dig into the demolition, carrying all of the old wall material out through the house, by hand. Norm visits a salvage yard in Boston's South End that has dozens of architectural elements from the Greek Revival period, including a marble mantel and some glass doorknobs that are perfect for Angela's house. Several days later, Mark starts installing the homeowner's choice for the retaining wall: an interlocking concrete system with a bluestone cap. Richard shows Kevin the progress on the rough plumbing and electrical, including a high velocity mini duct system that will pair with an electric inverter heat pump unit to supply either air handlers or high wall cassette units. It's an efficient and quiet solution, which is perfect for this close-knit City location.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Wood and Water
programme.desc: Richard stops by the Charlestown Navy Yard to see a very special guest arrive: the last wooden whaling ship in the world, the Charles W. Morgan, which was built c.1840, just a decade before our project house. At the jobsite, Norm finds architect Sally DeGan, who shares the good news that after months of work and waiting, our new dormer was finally approved. Up at the roofline, Tom shows Norm the progress on the dormer, and how he's carefully waterproofing its low slope roof. Inside, Kevin notes progress: insulation went in a few days ago and wallboard is going up. Out back, to tie in the new work with the old house, mason Mark McCullough installs a reclaimed brick veneer on the new kitchen bump out. Kevin drops in to see kitchen designer Kathy Marshall at her studio in Wenham, Massachusetts, where she is working on the interior design details with homeowner Angela Daigle. For a more authentic look, Norm and Tom replace the fake, applied vinyl shutters on our house with authentic, operable shutters make out of durable fiberglass and PVC.

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Gardens and Greek Revival
programme.desc: Roger visits the Sullivan Square Community Garden, while Richard works with fireplace expert John Sullivan to rough in the ductwork for the new direct vent gas fireplace units. With plaster work and flooring completed, Norm and Tom add some subtle Greek Revival details to the interior window trim package. For inspiration for her own urban garden, Roger takes homeowner Angela Daigle to see some the hidden gardens of Beacon Hill. Painting contractor Mauro Henrique paints the exterior window trim on our rowhouse, and puts up samples of a few bold color choices for the new front door

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Kitchens and Baths
programme.desc: Kevin finds Tom getting ready for a major upgrade to the front of the house: a new four-panel front door with glass transom and sidelights in traditional Greek Revival style. Inside, Kevin and Tom recall some of their favorite TOH kitchens over the years before seeing another one in progress Angela's cabinets have arrived from Pennsylvania. On the second floor, Tom and Kevin install new wood wainscoting to replace the worn out, poorly made version that used to be there. Norm learns about Charlestown's ancient past from city archaeologist Joe Bagley, who provides a rare look at his warehouse of artifacts in storage and testing at Boston's own archaeology lab. Tile contractor Mark Ferrante uses a marble basket weave tile from an online supplier to make a feature wall insert in the master shower. At the back addition, Kevin and Tom install a small section of copper roof to add a bit of character and long-term durability to the small roof

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | Rowhouse, Lighthouse
programme.desc: Tom builds a hidden door to the basement by concealing it behind a system of rails and stiles that look like paneling. Marble specialist Danny Puccio shows Kevin the new Carrara marble island top and how they made the delicate ogee edge detail back at the shop. Angela gives Roger the news that despite a beautiful new design for her backyard, her budget is beyond stretched and she'll have to hold off on planting until next year. Fence contractor Mark Bushway installs a new PVC fence on top of the retaining wall to provide some privacy for the backyard. Richard heads out on the water to see how one intrepid homeowner is turning one of Boston's iconic lighthouses into his family's summer home. Norm and Tom restore the old, weather beaten exterior front steps with a grinder, a router, some epoxy, and a non-slip exterior paint. Stone specialist Steve Torok installs the salvaged marble mantel and surround in the sitting room

programme.title: Charlestown 2014 | A Rowhouse Reimagined
programme.desc: After five months of work in Charlestown, the exterior is nicely restored thanks to a new dormer, windows, shutters, and front entry. Inside, Kevin finds systems integrator Greg Smizer test-driving the new internet-based security system, wireless music system and remote controlled window shades with solar battery back up. Norm meets closet designer Brian McSharry to see the pros and cons of designing a closet around a window. Richard shows Angela the basics of cooking with induction technology: her new cooktop relies on a magnetic field to generate heat within the pots and pans, instead of a traditional heating element. Norm meets up with Richard in the partially unfinished basement to see the mechanical room, where the systems integrate to provide comfort for the whole house. Kevin checks out Angela's new outdoor kitchen: powder coated stainless steel cabinets, a gas grill, and soapstone countertops. On the third floor, Kevin finds Angela and her mission accomplished: a serene master suite retreat where she can rest and relax. On the second floor, interior designer Kathy Marshall shows Norm the changes to the guest room, guest bath and bold new living room painted cranberry red, even on the ceiling. Downstairs, Kathy joins Angela and Kevin to see the former dining room transformed into a sophisticated sitting room, and all of the details of the new kitchen: cabinetry, tile, storage, a splashy new powder room, and the window seat addition that was worth all of the hard work

programme.title: Lexington Colonial | Colonial Roots
programme.desc: This Old House kicks off the second project of their 35th Anniversary Season: an addition to a 1966 Colonial Revival in historic Lexington, Mass. With a history that extends back to the time of the American Revolution, Lexington is home to a strong tradition of Colonial-style homes that are still popular today. Homeowners Jeremy and Jody Kieval love the neighborhood but not necessarily the tall trees that hide the front of their house they'd like a curb appeal makeover that includes more sunlight and a big new farmer's porch. Inside, the front hall and dining room are working well, but the overflowing playroom needs to be relocated. Jeremy loves to cook and wants his dream kitchen to become the new heart of the home, so the nearly 50-year-old kitchen will be gutted and redesigned. Jody laments the lack of mudroom and access to the garage-but all of that will be taken care of by the new addition. All of the new upstairs space goes to the girls: the plan is to add two more bedrooms, a laundry room, and a sitting area over the garage. Norm meets architect Bill Hubner to discuss the features of the existing house, and how he's incorporated them into a plan for a sympathetic addition. In the 1980s-era great room, Richard explains why the tall room is hard to heat despite the best efforts of the baseboard and electric heat. Downstairs, the lack of insulation needs to be addressed and the heating and cooling systems may not be sized to support all of the new work in the addition. Roger shows Kevin the small stream in the backyard and the lengths that we're going go through to protect it during construction.
